snippet: Efforts to free the Democratic convention from business and lobbyist support have prompted charges of hypocrisy from Republicans and grumbling among some Democrats.
abstract: Intersection of Duke Energy's financial interests under its chief executive James E Rogers and its support for the Democratic National Convention is testing Pres Obama's pledge to free the party's gathering from business and lobbyist support; Republicans are accusing the convention organizers of hypocrisy, and some Democrats are saying the White House set itself up for the charges.
lead_paragraph: Efforts to free the Democratic convention from business and lobbyist support have prompted charges of hypocrisy from Republicans and grumbling among some Democrats.

headline.seo: Duke Energy’s Convention Support Tests Obama Fund-Raising Pledge
headline.main: Utility’s Role in Convention Tests Obama
headline.print_headline: Utility’s Role In Convention Tests Obama
